gameDescription: In Operation Pollination, players commandeer advanced airships in a near future where the survival of bees and the global ecosystem is at stake. The game combines strategic decision-making with environmental conservation, focusing on the crucial role bees play in our world.

blueTeam.name: Apis Aviators
blueTeam.description: Experts in restoring ecosystems post-natural disasters.

redTeam.name: Bombus Navigators
redTeam.description: Specializing in the conservation and propagation of bee populations.

turns.scenario: In the aftermath of a devastating hurricane, bee habitats have been destroyed.

options.A: Plant native flowers in hurricane-affected areas to restore bee habitats.
options.B: Establish new bee colonies in safe zones, ensuring their survival post-disaster.

AA.narrative: Both teams chose to launch a floral cultivation program. Thanks to their hard work, they are gradually restoring the lost habitats, allowing bee populations to start rebounding.

AB.narrative: With the Apis Aviators restoring habitats with native flowers and Bombus Navigators establishing colonies in protected areas, bees are being given a fighting chance against extinction.

BA.narrative: As Bombus Navigators work to establish new colonies, the Apis Aviators plant beneficial flowers in the ravaged areas. The bees gain a new home and a source of nourishment.

BB.narrative: Both teams decide to create safe zones for new bee colonies. Their efforts ensure the survival of several bee species, reducing the risk of ecological imbalance.

turns.scenario: Wildfires have ravaged vast regions, affecting local bee populations.

options.A: Seed fire-ravaged areas with bee-friendly vegetation to encourage ecological recovery.
options.B: Create artificial bee habitats in unaffected regions to support displaced populations.

AA.narrative: Both teams focus on seeding areas destroyed in the wildfires. Their dedicated efforts begin paying off as regrowth supports the return of displaced bee populations.

AB.narrative: The Apis Aviators plant ardently, while the Bombus Navigators set up temporary artificial habitats. Their combined efforts provide nationwide support to the affected bees.

BA.narrative: Bombus Navigators cover the fire-ravaged land with seeds while the Apis Aviators construct artificial habitats. Both initiatives offer surviving bees a lifeline.

BB.narrative: Both teams opt for the establishment of artificial bee habitats. These sanctuaries serve as a refuge, ensuring the sustainability of bee populations during the recovery period.

turns.scenario: The teams face the challenge of sustainable expansion, aiming to protect bees in the long term.

options.A: Develop bee sanctuaries with advanced ecological technology for optimal habitat conditions.
options.B: Launch educational campaigns to promote bee conservation and awareness.

AA.narrative: Both teams invest in advanced ecological technology to create ideal bee habitats. Their high-tech sanctuaries serve as the model for future conservation efforts.

AB.narrative: The Apis Aviators pioneer advanced bee sanctuaries while the Bombus Navigators launch a comprehensive education campaign. Together, they impact both the bee population and public awareness.

BA.narrative: The Bombus Navigators build state-of-the-art bee sanctuaries, while the Apis Aviators embark on a widespread educational campaign. Their strategies mark an upturn in bee conservation.

BB.narrative: Both teams launch wide-scale educational campaigns. Their efforts not only raise public awareness on bee conservation but also spur action to protect these essential creatures.
